posts._title: Richard Wallace – The Young in Heart (1938)
posts.title: The Young in Heart
posts.excerpt: The Carletons make a living as card sharps and finding new suckers to mooch off of. When their latest scam backfires, they are asked to leave Monte Carlo. At the train station, they meet Miss Fortune, a very wealthy but lonely elderly lady. As a reward for saving her life after the train derails, Miss …

posts.title: The Shopworn Angel
posts.excerpt: Plot: During WWI Bill Pettigrew, a naive young Texan soldier is sent to New York for basic training. He meets worldly wise actress Daisy Heath when her car nearly runs him over. Daisy agrees to pretend to be Bill’s girl to impress his friends, but then a real romance begins. Written by Col Needham

posts._title: Raffaello Matarazzo – La nave delle donne maledette AKA The Ship of Condemned Women (1953)
posts.title: La nave delle donne maledette
posts.excerpt: Caged of the sins of their past, they break for freedom climaxed by an orgy of wanton lust and revenge.This interesting twist to “the ship of lost souls” theme has a ship of women convicts being taken to the colonies to be kept under control. One of these, Britt, has been framed in the killing …

posts._title: Jean-Claude Brisseau – La croisée des chemins (1976)
posts.title: La croisée des chemins
posts.excerpt: The peregrinations of a group of boys and girls from Paris. Two girls swap the capital for the countryside near Montpellier. One of the girls hesitates between dream world and reality.La croisée des chemins marks the start of a significant oeuvre and is a film in which reality and dream are mixed. Jean-Claude Brisseau shot …

posts.title: Numéro zéro
posts.excerpt: A family portrait in which the director profiles his grandmother.

posts._title: Luis Buñuel – Ensayo de un crimen AKA The Criminal Life of Archibaldo de la Cruz (1955)
posts.title: Ensayo de un crimen
posts.excerpt: Quote:The delirious journey of a mental disordered man, who is obsessed in making the perfect crime.
posts.titleEnglish: The Criminal Life of Archibaldo de la Cruz

posts._title: Francis Leroi – Les jours et les nuits d’Eva Blue AKA The Hidden Vices of Eva Blue (1979)
posts.title: Les jours et les nuits d’Eva Blue
posts.excerpt: A high-class working woman can finally relax and meet all the lovers she desires throughout the weekend. She spends all her free time into lovemaking but unbeknownst to her, a man is lurking wherever she goes and recording everything she does.
posts.titleEnglish: The Hidden Vices of Eva Blue

posts._title: François Leterrier – Les mauvais coups aka Naked Autumn (1961)
posts.title: Les mauvais coups
posts.excerpt: An ex-racing driver (Reginald Kernan) lives in the country with his aging wife (Simone Signoret). They spend their days quarrelling and baiting each other, and making up uneasily before starting again. The new village school teacher (Alexandra Stewart) enters the scene, threatening to upset the love-hate balance of the couple.

posts._title: Jean Rouch – Petit à petit AKA Little by Little (1970)
posts.title: Petit à petit
posts.excerpt: Jean Rouch’s Nigerien collaborators travel to France to perform a reverse ethnography of late-1960’s Parisian life.

posts._title: Bettina Blümner – Prinzessinnenbad AKA Pool of Princesses (2007)
posts.title: Prinzessinnenbad
posts.excerpt: PrinzessinnenbadDirector: Bettina Blümner Seit ihrer Kindheit kennen sich die nun 15-jährigen und lebenshungrigen Mädchen Klara, Mina und Tanutscha. Seit je gehen sie auf die gleichen Partys, stehen auf die gleichen Jungs und entspannen im Prinzenbad. An der Schwelle zum Erwachsenwerden sind sie nun auf der Suche nach ihrem eigenen Weg. Auf Schule hat Klara, die …
